title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Henderson, Mr., Eildon Hall, his funeral, ii.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: This night I went to the funeral of Mr. Henderson, late of Eildon Hall,a kind-hearted man, who rose to great wealth by honest means, and willbe missed and regretted.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Butgoing to Eildon Hall to-day, and to Drumlanrig to-morrow, there wasnothing more could be done for them.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: On the right, at the base of the Eildou Hills, is Eildon Hall (Mrs. Baillie).

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: This day I went to the funeral of Mr. Henderson, late of Eildon Hall, a kind-hearted man, who rose to great wealth by honest means, and will be missed and regretted.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: But going to Eildon Hall to-day, and to Drumlanrig to-morrow,  there was nothing more could be done for them.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: But going to Eildon Hall today,  and to Drumlanrig to-morrow, there was nothing more could be done for them.

title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: There is a mossy bridle-path along the southern foot of the mountain, through the woods of Eildon Hall, and this is the pleasantest wayto make the descent.
